For old friends, we look forward to seeing you again. For new ones, we cannot wait to meet you!

Our Story

From the beginning, our love was an endless adventure

  • November 2nd, 2017

    Once Upon a Time

    Like all modern fairytales, we first discovered each other on Coffee Meets Bagel. After a week of banter over the phone, we met in a tiny dimly lit dive: two people, having only impressions of each other off 5 pictures and 3 paragraphs of text. Maybe it was her cute poses and aggressively bubbly love for artsy fartsy things, or maybe it was his smart charm and flirty comments – no matter the reason, the connection we found started our journey

  • October 4th, 2018

    Home Sweet Home

    From the bucolic bustle of Upper East Side, we made the decision to move in together. While we had searched for almost half a year, Erica fell in love with the flowery gardens, abundance of puppies (2 and 4 legged), and the amazing food of Park Slope.

  • August 23rd, 2020

    I Don't Like Sunsets!

    In our three years together, our sense of adventure took us from the cozy parks of upper east side, onto the train from Busan, over the foggy bridges of London, and surfing the waves of Hawaii. With months in the planning for the perfect moment, I caught her off guard during a beach getaway. While there was some convincing before she would go on a sunset stroll (thanks @whitney), we made her walk worth it when I got down on one knee.

  • October 3rd, 2020

    Ruff Times

    2020 was a tough time for everyone - we weren’t able to see loved ones, traveling was risky, and all of our cushions developed memory foam. One Saturday morning, Erica rolled over and said, ‘We have to get a puppy’. It was months of convincing before I said OK, which became one of the best decisions of my life. It was the silver lining throughout the pandemic. Both of our families could not have been more welcoming (spoiling) to their new grandchild!

Location

Our wedding will be hosted by the Swan Club, a beautiful waterfront venue in Roslyn Harbor, Long Island

Schedule

11:00 - 11:30 :Ceremony
11:30 - 12:30 :Cocktail Hour
12:30 - 04:30 :Reception

Questions

What should I wear? Is there a dress code?

The dress code for our wedding is cocktail attire. Ladies should wear cocktail dresses, and the gentlemen should wear a suit jacket or a sports coat.

What will the weather be like this time of year?

The weather is expected to be hot, but the event aside from the ceremony (weather allowing) will take place indoors.

Will there be alcohol?

Yes! We have an open bar at our event.

What should I do if I can’t make it?

You will be missed! If you can not make it to the wedding, please let us know as soon as possible and RSVP “no,” so we can plan accordingly.

How do I get to the venue?

The best way is to take the LIRR (Atlantic Ave / Penn Station -> (Ronkonkoma bound) Mineola -> (Oyster Bay Bound) Glen Head. From there you can get a brief Uber, or if you do not mind walking it is only about 15-20min walking to the destination

What time should I arrive

We recommend that you arrive 15 minutes before the start of the ceremony, to make sure everyone is on time and we can get the party started as scheduled!

Will there be parking?

Yes there will be free parking! The venue has a large parking lot.

Are kids welcome?

Yes you may bring your kids!

Can I bring a date?

If you would like to bring your significant other, we would love to accomodate them! Please RSVP with their name on the form.

When is the RSVP deadline?

Our RSVP deadline is a month before the event - June 3rd, 2021.

Are the ceremony and reception location wheelchair accessible?

Yes!

Will food and drinks be served at the reception? What kind of food?

Yes, we will have food stations during cocktail hour followed by a sit-down meal during the reception.

May I take flowers home as a souvenir?

Feel free to take a floral centerpiece arrangement home! Other decor pieces are rented, so we would really appreciate it if they were left as is.

Can I take and post pictures of the wedding on social media?

Yes, we encourage guests to post pictures on to their social media channels. We would greatly appreciate it if you tag each photo with our wedding hashtag #leungwildandfree so we can keep track of all of your pictures!

Contact Us

If you have any other questions, please send us a note!
